bibl.title: History of Case and Notes of Post-Mortem Conducted on the Body of Garuba - Camp-Master, From Mile 273., by D. Fitzgerald Moore, [December, 1923]

div1.p: Moore submits a case history and post-mortem report on a Nigerian who died of a fever.

div1.head: History of Case and Notes of Post-Mortem Conducted on the Body of Garuba - Camp-Master, From Mile 273., by D. Fitzgerald Moore, [December, 1923]
div1.p:
GARUBA. NATIVE. AGE? CAMP-OVERSEER ON RAILWAY CONSTRUCTION,
NEAR MAKURDI, SOUTHERN PROVINCES, NIGERIA.
Seen by Medical Officer at 3:30 p.m. same day.

Had been ill for about 4 days. Illness started with intense
pains all over body, especially in the head and eyes.

He had been vomiting nearly black fluid and jaundice had
been noticed on the day previous to admission to Hospital.

His conjunctives were now intensely jaundiced. He was
muttering, moving from side to side and continually trying to
get out of bed.
The lips were covered with large sores.
Thick yellow mucoid discharge running from mouth.

Owing to the extreme restlessness it was impossible to
examine him satisfactorily, and no signs were made out either in
chest or abdomen.

He died at 5:30 a.m., 13/7/23, i.e. he was in Hospital 15 1/2
hours, during which time there was no vomiting, and no faeces or
urine were passed.

(Signed) D. Fitzgerald Moore.
Construction Medical Officer
Makurdi

list.head:
NOTES OF POST-MORTEM CONDUCTED ON THE BODY OF
GARUBA - CAMP-MASTER, FROM MILE 273.
list.item: Mouth, contains deep yellow mucoid discharge.

Urine, catheterised off, intensely dark. Quantity about 4 test-tubes -full.
Albumen present in moderate quantities (Do not possess Esbach apparatus.)
Chest, same condition prevails intense yellow colour. Cartilages very yellow.

Lungs, yellow, densely pigmented. Many petechiae. Both lungs show a good
number of adhesions at the base; no pneumonic patches.
Pericardium, slight yellow free fluid present. No adhesions.

Heart appears normal in size, densely yellow, filled with small amount dark
blood, not clotted; valves natural.

On opening abdomen, the whole appearance intensely yellow, fine congestion,
and many ecchymoses around gut, well-marked submucous haemorrhages.
Great Omentum filled with minute petechial haemorrhages.

Liver, very patchy in colour, many light and dark areas and very obviously
congested. On section this is strongly marked. Moderately friable.
Section showed nutmeg appearance, cutting fairly firm but appearance in-
tensely yellow.
Stomach is filled with frothy blood-stained contents, dark in colour.

Spleen considerably enlarged and many adhesions to Diaphragm and chest wall,
intensely congested. A hard bony swelling is felt attached to outer side,
which appears to be an old fractured rib.

Capsule adherent to kidneys. On section, the kidneys appear yellow and
congested.

div1.p:
(Signed) D. Fitzgerald Moore.
Construction Medical Officer
Makurdi
